analyzed: atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: “Is there an ultimate for an ordinary person?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is there an ultimate for one who has killed his mother? …

analyzed: mātu ghātakaḥ accantaniyataḥ pitu ghātakaḥ pe
translated: for one who has killed his father? …
for one who has killed an arahant? …
for one who has maliciously drawn blood from a Buddha? …
for one who has caused a schism in the Sangha?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: “Is there an ultimate for an ordinary person?”

analyzed: accanta niyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā uppajjeyya ati
translated: “Would doubt arise in a person who has an ultimate?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci accantaniyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā uppajjeyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci accanta niyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā uppajjeyya no ca vata re vattabbe
atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: that there is an ultimate for an ordinary person.”

analyzed: accanta niyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā nuppajjeyya ati
translated: “Would doubt not arise in a person who has an ultimate?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  sakadāgāmi maggena pe  anāgāmi maggena pe
translated: “No.”🔽“By the path of once-returning?”🔽“By the path of non-returning?”
“You go too far. You are wrong. Don’t say so.

original: Katamena maggenāti?🔽Akusalena maggenāti.🔽Akusalo maggo niyyāniko khayagāmī bodhagāmī anāsavo …pe… asaṅkilesikoti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽nanu akusalo maggo aniyyāniko …pe…🔽saṅkilesikoti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Hañci akusalo maggo aniyyāniko …pe…🔽saṅkilesiko, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“accantaniyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā akusalena maggena pahīnā”ti.🔽Sassatadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa ucchedadiṭṭhi uppajjeyyāti?
analyzed: katamena maggena ati  akusalena maggena ati  akusalaḥ maggaḥ niyyānikaḥ khaya gāmī bodha gāmī anāsavaḥ pe asaṅkilesikaḥ ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu akusalaḥ maggaḥ aniyyānikaḥ pe  saṅkilesikā iti  āmantā  hañci akusalaḥ maggaḥ aniyyānikaḥ pe  saṅkilesikaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe  accanta niyatassa puggalassa vicikicchā akusalena maggena pahīnā ati  sassata diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa uccheda diṭṭhi uppajjeyya ati

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci sassatadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa ucchedadiṭṭhi uppajjeyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“atthi puthujjanassa accantaniyāmatā”ti.🔽Sassatadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa ucchedadiṭṭhi nuppajjeyyāti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Pahīnāti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…

original: Akusalo maggo …pe… no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: akusalaḥ maggaḥ pe no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: … ‘It is not so, friend. It is not right to say:

original: “sassatadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa ucchedadiṭṭhi akusalena maggena pahīnā”ti.
analyzed: sassata diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa uccheda diṭṭhi akusalena maggena pahīnā ati
translated: “The view of eternalism of a person definitely affected by the view of eternalism is abandoned by an unwholesome path.”’

analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassata diṭṭhi uppajjeyya ati
translated: Would the view of annihilation arise in a person definitely affected by the view of annihilation?

original: Hañci ucchedadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassatadiṭṭhi uppajjeyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci uccheda diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassata diṭṭhi uppajjeyya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: ‘Well then, it is not right to say:

analyzed: atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: “There is no absolute certainty for an ordinary person.”’

analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassata diṭṭhi nuppajjeyya
translated: Would the view of eternalism not arise in a person definitely affected by the view of annihilation?

original: Akusalena maggenāti.🔽Akusalo maggo …pe… no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: akusalena maggena ati  akusalaḥ maggaḥ pe no ca vata re vattabbe

original: “ucchedadiṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassatadiṭṭhi akusalena maggena pahīnā”ti.
analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhiyā niyatassa puggalassa sassata diṭṭhi akusalena maggena pahīnā ati
translated: But it is not right to say that the view of annihilation is given up by the unwholesome path.”

analyzed: atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: there is absolute certainty for an ordinary person.”
“But was it not said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo samannāgato hoti ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi, so sakiṁ nimuggo nimuggova hotī”ti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ samannāgataḥ hoti ekanta kāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi so sakim nimuggaḥ nimuggaḥ uva hoti iti
translated: ‘Here, bhikkhus, one kind of person possesses entirely dark, unwholesome qualities. Having died and passed on, he goes to the destination of those possessing entirely dark, unwholesome qualities. Having gone there, he is not freed from suffering, I say.’

analyzed: tena hi atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: “Then it must be said that there is absolute certainty for an ordinary person.”
“It was said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo samannāgato hoti ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi,
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ samannāgataḥ hoti ekanta kāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi
translated: ‘Here, bhikkhus, one kind of person possesses entirely dark, unwholesome qualities.

original: so sakiṁ nimuggo nimuggova hotī”ti katvā tena ca kāraṇena atthi puthujjanassa accantaniyāmatāti?
analyzed: saḥ sakim nimuggaḥ nimuggaḥ uva hoti iti katvā tena ca kāraṇena atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: Is it because of that reason that there is absolute certainty for the ordinary person?”
It was said by the Blessed One:

analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjitvā nimujjati iti
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, someone emerges but then submerges.”
“Does he always emerge and then submerge?”
It was said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo samannāgato hoti ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi, so sakiṁ nimuggo nimuggova hotī”ti—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ samannāgataḥ hoti ekanta kāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi so sakim nimuggaḥ nimuggaḥ uva hoti iti
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, someone is endowed entirely with dark, unwholesome qualities, and he is submerged, utterly submerged.”

original: katvā tena ca kāraṇena atthi puthujjanassa accantaniyāmatāti?
analyzed: katvā tena ca kāraṇena atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā ati
translated: Is it because of that reason that there is absolute certainty for the ordinary person?”
It was said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti, ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi, ummujjitvā patarati, ummujjitvā patigādhappatto hotī”ti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjitvā ṭhitaḥ hoti ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi ummujjitvā patarati ummujjitvā pati gādha ppattaḥ hoti iti
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, someone emerges and then stands; having emerged and stood, he looks around; having emerged, stood, and looked around, he crosses over; having emerged, stood, looked around, and crossed over, he reaches the far shore.”

analyzed: sabbakālam ummujjitvā pati gādhappattaḥ hoti iti
translated: Is he always emerging and accepting?
The Discussion of the Definitely Limited is finished.
